pullRequest.body:
In a countably generated measurable space `α`, we can build a sequence of finer and finer finite measurable partitions of the space such that the measurable space is generated by the union of all partitions.
This sequence of partitions (`countablePartition α n`) is defined in `MeasureTheory.MeasurableSpace.CountablyGenerated`. This is a new file in which we put the definition of `CountablyGenerated` (which was previously in MeasurableSpace.Basic).

In `Probability.Process.CountablyGenerated`, we build the filtration generated by `countablePartition α n` for all `n : ℕ`, which we call `countableFiltration α`.

---

I did not finish the generalization of most lemmas to arbitrary sequences of sets yet (and I had an almost lean-free week). I'll update this tomorrow.

bors d+

I have an issue with the design here. You are starting from a countably generated measurable space, pick some countable generating set, and then construct very useful object from it. However, I have several examples in mind where I would like to do this using a specific countable generating set with nice properties, not the one that is provided by choice. And also examples where I would like to play this game, but the countable set would not generate the whole sigma-algebra.

Do you think it would be possible to develop a general framework starting from a structure `N -> Set \alpha` for which all sets are measurable, and associate to it all the objects in your construction? And then specialize  it to your countable generating set?

LGTM, thanks!
bors d+

I'd really like to avoid the `n+1` here and below, by putting in `memPartition n` the things generated by `f 0, ..., f (n-1)` (i.e., `f i` for `i` in `range n`). This would correspond more closely to the indexing conventions in mathlib.
Could you use `x` instead of `t` for a point, to emphasize that it doesn't have the same nature as `s`? Here and below.
This name is a little bit too generic. `countableGeneratingSet` would probably be better, as the point is really the countability.

```suggestion
`2^n` sets. Each partition is finer than the preceeding one. The measurable space generated by
the union of all those partitions is the measurable space on `α`. -/
```

```suggestion
those spaces. By building a martingale with respect to `countableFiltration α` and using the
martingale convergence theorems, we can define a measurable function on `α`.
```
This formulation gives the impression that this is done in this file, which is not the case. Could you clarify a little that this is an interesting potential application of this construction, but not done here?
The file-level docstring is not really on par with the content of the file, could you update it to reflect what you have added?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: countable filtration in a countably generated measurable space
